attributes.comment:
I am appalled that the government is considering raising the fees yet again for
the I-600 applications for adoptive parents. Foreign adoptions are already very
expensive and it is becoming affordable only the the wealthy. We have adopted
three children internationally in 2002, 2004 and 2006. Each time we submitted an
application the fees increased and so did our wait time. The last time was the
longest and it was for a special needs child. Instead of raising the prices and
throwing money at the issue the UCICS needs to take a look at their own
inefficiencies in administration of the process for I-600s. There is a huge
disparity in the treatment of adoptive parents across the country depending on
which office one is forced to use. Our designated office in San Antonio started
out OK back in 2002 and has turned into a nightmare with a bullish orphan
officer the last few years. Now they are just completley inefficient. Why is is
that the government thinks that charging more money will help them increaes
their productiveness. It hasn't happened yet and I don't expect anything to
change by raising the fees another $100. What would make it more efficient is to
draw on best practices from the local agencies that are doing it right, create
some consistency and for goodness sake and make the approval last longer so that
people don't have to re-file before they even get a referral for an adoption.
This would save a lot of the backlog for the orphan officers. It would also be
nice if there was an expedited process for those families adopting special needs
children so that these kids needing medical attention are not needlessly
languishing in orphanages becuase a family cannot get an I-171 back in a
reasonable length of time. Please do something to fix this process and do not
raise the prices on already financially strained families trying to make a
family via adoption.

Holly Brooke

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Holly A. Brooke
